The output which is the propulsive effect is divided by the output plus the unutilized kinetic energy of the exhaust stream. (This is defined in terms of power). The power due to the propulsive effect is FVa, where Va is the flight speed of the vehicle carrying the propulsive unit. The losses in the jet are estimated to be ma(Ve Va)2 / 2 since Veis the velocity of the jet relative to the propulsive unit, and (Ve Va)2/2 the kinetic energy per unit mass flow rate of the jet.
